Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2011 12:42PM MrsMot wrote: K1122 glad to hear you are feeling good.  Taking away my fear.  Curious as to what fluids you have to drink?  Is it just hard to drink water?  Your words are very very encouraging.  My best to you and your treatment!!!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2011 12:51PM MrsMot wrote: vlnrph - Don't be jealous. The weather is the only reason to live here...oh and wine country!!  Not to go on a tangent...this state has so many problems and its too expensive to live here.  But come and visit any time.  Meanwhile, Glad to hear you didn't have as many surgeries as I did.  My surgical oncologist really believed he could save my breast.  But in the end, the pathology showed a 7,0 cm size so...off it went.  I wish I would have done the mastectomy first...but I trusted my doctor and we tried.  When looking at others tumor size...I got them all beat.  I just don't know how it grew so big in one year.  My last year's mammo was normal.  Within 12 months I get this mammoth size tumor and a trip to hell.  But I am a survivor!!!  Can't wait for 2012...gotta be a better year! Take care!!!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2011 05:00PM MrsMot wrote: Day 2 of my first infusion and so far so good.  I got my neulsta shot today...feeling very tired.  I am hoping the body aches aren't that bad...time will tell.  I am very thirsty too.  Been drinking alot of water, which I normally do prior to this cancer nightmare.  I am positive and ready to be over with this.  I was calm yesterday then had a major meltdown as soon as I sat in the "chair" and saw everyone around me.  The tears came and I couldn't hold back.  But then it was over and I felt better. Of course the only pain I got was from my dog gone period hit me and I got bad cramps.  Only me.  Advil to the rescue! Thanks for all your support.  This discussion board is helping me beyond words.  Just reading how you all are doing.  Keep up the good work ladies.  I am proud of all of you!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2011 10:53AM MrsMot wrote: CrimsonQ66 - Gosh I hope you can clean house.  The clean house came out in the way of diarrhea and its been 3 days and I still have it.  Would rather have that then the constipation cramps.  I contacted my digestive doc and he has me on Metamucil and Miralax.  I will take the Miralax day of next chemo with come Colease.  With the Metamucil.  I hope and pray that works.  The cramps are all too much.  Its day 6 after chemo and I am finally getting my energy back...but dealing with the digestive issues!  To me I would rather deal with nausea then these issues.  Now I need an Imodian to stop the diarrhea!  OMG...5 more infusions. Hope you feel better Crimson - I know all too well how you feel now!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 08:34PM MrsMot wrote: StaceyLynn - You can do it and you will.  You are almost at the finish line.  Big hugs to ya...  Revmama - hope it gets better.  Thinking about you! I do #3 in 3 weeks...I only hope that it goes well.  Keep us posted on how you are doing. Finished #2 - this time around I am ready for any digestive issues.  Not gonna let it happen!  My toes are tingling...nerves (neuropathy).   Good luck and God Bless to all!

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2011 02:09PM MrsMot wrote: Thank you Chickadee and KII22 - Today is better.  The steriods have kicked in and I feel good.  Depression gone.  Three more sessions and I will join you guys!  So there is an end in sight.  I am positive again.  My hormones are going nuts.  I slept last night good so today is a much better day. To all those on the east coast...hope you faired the big earthquake ok.  I live with them all the time...don't like them...but its part of life in California.  I will take an earthquake over cancer anyday!   Have a good day everyone!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2011 06:58PM - edited Aug 30, 2011 06:59PM by MrsMot Anyone out there suffer from swelled hands and hives?  I went to bed last night with my hands hurting.  Thankfully I removed my wedding set or it would have had to be cut off.  Woke up in early am (4:30 am) with hands twice the size and hives all over my beautiful bald head, neck and arms...and it was getting worse.  Called oncologist...off to the ER.  Bendryl had no effect.  ER doc sent me home on a sterod and its been over 10 hours and they are still puffed out.  ER doc consulted with my oncologist and guess its a normal reaction.  What fun this all is!!!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2011 08:52PM - edited Oct 24, 2011 08:53PM by MrsMot I did it! I am done with chemo!!!  Today was number 6.  In two weeks I will start to feel better.  I call the Radiologist tomorrow for appointments.  My dr said to wait 3-4 weeks before radiation.  Any suggestions/tips for my next phase?  SO HAPPY TO BE DONE WITH CHEMO!!!!!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2011 02:38PM MrsMot wrote: OK...how to you ward off the constipation?  I got it so bad...4 days.  Had to take a Milk of Magenesia which justs goes straight to diarrhea.  Bad night...Day 4 was my down day...no energy.  But add the pain of the constipation...made for a rough night.  Feeling better today (day 5) .  Anyone take anything over the counter to prevent the constipation?  I suffer from IBS so I have a battle on my hands but I don't want this issue every chemo week.
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2011 09:48AM MrsMot wrote: NO sleep!  I took two Advil/PMs last night and no effect.  Got maybe 3 hours.  Is this a new SE??? Any suggestions?  I really don't like the idea of perscription sleep aids..but jeesh...I want to sleep again.  I have had two rounds of TC.  Four more to go.
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2011 08:55PM MrsMot wrote: Thanks KII22 - this round has put me in bed.  I feel lousy.  I didn't sleep the night before and the benedryl didn't put me to sleep.  I felt a bit queezy...so I am now in bed at 8:30pm...  I took a compazine and that helped with the queezyness.  I think I answered my own question when I see all of your stages under diagnosis.  I am stage 3 and ya'll are stage 1.  My damn tumor was 7 cm is size and was lobular.  I also had 6 cancerous lymph nodes.  I can never win the lottery...but I can get cancer in a big way!!! Got a touch of depression...I know it will pass.  At least I hope.  So now its time to manage the SE for round 3!! Sorry to dump...but I needed an outlet.  Everyone sees me as strong, a fighter, a tough woman...but I am not always.  Thanks for reading my thoughts.  Love you all!  I wish you all health and a long life ahead!!!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2011 03:01PM MrsMot wrote: I asked my dr about Effexor and he put me on Neurontin instead.  A coworker (who is a 7 year survivor of BC) told me about it.  I don't know why the dr chose something else for me, but he is the dr and I am relying on his judgement.  Best of luck to you KII22...any relief is welcome from hot flashes!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2011 09:38PM MrsMot wrote: I just finished #5.  In 3 weeks I will get my LAST treatment!!!  Feeling very tired right now.  Doctor switched my hot flash meds to Effexor.  The Neurotin stopped working for me.  I hope this stuff helps my mood swings too!  Last monday I had an infusion of iron...so I hope no extreme fatigues this go round. I cannot wait to be done....
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2011 12:26PM MrsMot wrote: Thanks KII22 - unfortunately..bad SE's...maybe cause of 5 rounds.  I actually got nauseated at one point...first time.  Thanks to compazine no throwing up...but it came close!  BUT the storm cloulds are clearing and the sun is finally coming out.  Feeling much better.  Two weeks left.... I can't take the Effexor as the dr prescribed too strong amount (75 mg)...so I am winging hot flashes  without meds. I think the Effexor made my SE's worse this time around. Soon I will find out about radiation...  I can see the finish line!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2011 03:27PM MrsMot wrote: vlnrph YOU have made me feel so much better.  Thank you.  They give me the handout on the adverse reactions and its horrible.  Glad to hear it won't be that bad.  What goes on in my head just makes things worse.  I have completed 4 surgeries so far.  Two lumpectomys and then the big bilateral mastectomy with reconstrutive surgery...then a clean up surgery on the flaps.  The cancer is gone (in my mind and heart) so this chemo is a necessary evil to make sure it does not come back. As a fellow ILC sister...I wish you well too!   Thank you!

Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2011 02:20PM MrsMot wrote: CrimsonQ66...oh I suffer the constipation too.  I had chemo 2 on Monday and its started (constipation)...I am taking ducluax (same as Miralax) and just praying for it to work.  MoM gave me exploding painfull diahrrea.  Sorry...but that is what happend.  I too would rather have the diahrrea as its moving and leaving the body.  I read that the chemo kills the fast dividing cells as well as the cancer cells...those areas are hair and digestive systems.  Since I have a lousy digestive system in the first place (IBS) its hits me there.  The nurses gave me a handout and said to try Senokot...I have already spent a fortune on otc meds...but I guess it can't hurt.  I might run out today and try it.  I also have colace. VTEllen - nausea has not been a problem.  Don't even sweat that.  you will be fine.  I take Zofran 2xs a day for the first 3 days after chemo and a steriod.  I have compazine for "as needed."  Thankfully I haven't needed it.   I just want a normal digestive system...I don't ask for much!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2011 09:38PM - edited Sep 12, 2011 09:46PM by MrsMot Okay ladies - Just completed #4 today.  I still have two more.  But so far so good.  Please keep me posted on how soon your hair grows back (as all of you seem to be done with chemo).  I can't wait to finish and catch up with you all.  I feel like the younger sister and I am behind you all!  I want to hear how you are doing too!   I have hot flashes now...driving me nuts!  Gonna ask the doc about Effexor...if that will help!    PS - the swelled hands and hives were the result of an allergic reaction to the Taxotere.  So doc put me on a steroid and I feel great.  I am off it now...but will go back on it if the swelling and itching returns.  I only need two more then I am done!  I gotta keep the same path!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2011 02:42PM MrsMot wrote: This monday I start my first cycle of taxotere/cytoxan and I am so scared.  Any advice from anyone on preparing for this?  Do I eat before?  My appt is at noon and they will start with the blood work.  I am still recovering from the big DIEP surgery 4 weeks ago so I am still not able to get around like normal.  I am hormonal cos I keep crying thinking about what I have to do on Monday.  I am thinking the surgery has to be worse then the chemo but reading side effects puts me in a tailspin.  I don't care about the hair (well I do...but I know that will happen) I am just worried about the nulestra shot and chemo and how I will feel.

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2011 12:02PM MrsMot wrote: Kii and Chickadee...yay you are getting hair!  Five weeks!  wow.  I was hoping it would grow back faster than that.  Well congrats on where you are now.  So happy for you both.  Good luck with the Tamoxifen.  You guys are survivors!!!   Sorry to hear of the nail issue KII.  The doc gave me something for hot flashes and its working...making me really tired...but I have to get use to it.  I could not handle the hot flashes anymore.  Maybe your doctor can help...don't suffer!

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2011 10:46AM MrsMot wrote: Kii22 - may I ask what the drug for your hot flashes are?  I am currently taking Neurontin and it kinda works.  It has minimized the hot flashes.  Chemo gave me the hot flashes big time.  This med makes me whoozey though.  Not sure I want to continue using it.  The hot flashes would be good in the winter! This Monday is #5...almost done.

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2011 02:51PM MrsMot wrote: CrimsonQ66 - I cannot believe some people.  You don't need that in your life.  Your boss is not nipping that in the butt.  I am so sorry you have to deal with these type of men that cannot deal with it.  I work around men that are the opposite and very supportive.  I am also lucky that I have enough sick time to stay home during this.  If this guys bugs you more, go to your boss again and go above his head.  File a complaint.  Good for you for wearing scarfs.  I work for a city and no one could do what that guy did to you.  Hang in there sweetie!  He is an idiot...you are the strong survivor!!!

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 11:08AM - edited Aug 1, 2011 11:09AM by MrsMot Revmama - Hope you are better.  If not...call your doctor.  Don't mess around.  . Maryann - Its scarey the first time around cos you don't know how you will react.  I start #2 today and I am not that nervous...just not looking forward to the down time.  I felt bad day 4 after chemo then weak day 5 & 6 and started bouncing back.  For the past 2 weeks I have felt my old self and great.  I hope that lasts for #2 and rest (I have to have 6 total treatments). There are so many great posts here that will help you. It helped me...however, Chickadee said it right,,,everyone is different.  Don't psych yourself out that you will have all the issue everyone has.  You might not!  Best of luck and hang in there...you can do this and you WILL survive!!! Going to #2 today.   I pray it goes well as I am prepared this time...I can't wait to be done with all this!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2011 10:08AM MrsMot wrote: About to go in for number 3 today.  Anyone out there have to do 6 like me?  Seems everyone is doing 4.  Kinda depressing when I am only half way done.
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2011 10:35AM MrsMot wrote: Revmama - You gotta do it...You do not want the cancer to come back.  I have heard that rad is nothing compared to chemo.  It takes more time getting there and getting ready.  Hang in there.  You do not want to go through this again.  My cousin's breast cancer came back on her liver...she has been on chemo for 2 years...she is still with us and is fighting.  Don't let cancer come back...97% is good insurance,  Hang in there..  Sending hugs.
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2011 11:27AM MrsMot wrote: Thanks ladies!  Finally coming back from the dead.  Oh how I hate chemo.  Have a fantastic time in Jamaica Chickadee...you deserve it!  Thank you for the tips on rads KII22 - not so afraid of it now.  Hope the arm is getting better Vlnrph.  I fear that happening.  So far so good it has not.  Do you know what could have set it off?  Good luck with surgery.  I will have nipples made later..probably in January.  Oh joy! My husband and I are going to Hawaii in May 2012...long postponed Honeymoon (we have only been married over a year)...so I have much to live for!

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2011 05:42PM MrsMot wrote: I am on a down day with my chemo and just vegging watching TV and wondering why everyone gets a normal life but me....I have no hair..I'm 3 days constipated (from chemo)...and feeling just plain lousy.  You are not alone in your feelings Shockedat39!  I have the same exact thoughts. Why us?  Why did we get this? I just pray for an answer one day...which will mean a cure.  Be kind to yourself...you deserve it.  Sending Hugs!!!
Posts.Title: What is wrong with me???? shockedat39 Elizabeth1959

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 12:45PM MrsMot wrote: My cousin's breast cancer returned and is on her liver.  She had two years remission.  Her onc measures the tumor markers that are on her liver.  I have BC and my onc have not said anything about tumor markers either.  I think its something they can measure when it has spread.  I had both my breast removed and had 6 lymph nodes with cancer.  My onc will order a CT scan later...I think when I am done to make sure it has not spread.  I don't think you have to worry about tumor markers.  You have enough to worry about!  God bless and you will beat this and be a survivor!!!
Posts.Title: Tumor markers rochelleanderson rochelleanderson
